by Runs_With_Scissors on January 20th, 2009
In a toll booth, I've paid for the guy behind me. Never thought of doing so in a drive-thru at a fast food place. Today was the day to do it, though. LOL - I went to Starbucks and ran a few errands after the inagruation. I don't think I've seen so many ppl in such a great mood. It was like someone released happy gas all over the country.
Comments
Hi friend! Yes the energy was contagious today. I too was caught up in it and was happy to be part of history. +5

by Leeses Pieces is COATed in chocolate on January 20th, 2009
all the time.
and i don't do it for the bragging rights or so people can do something in return. i help people when i see the chance, especially if they are struggling.
there was this lady in the Home Depot parking lot who could not figure out how to get this new plastic storage bin in her 2-door sports car. i was able to get it in :)
or, letting people go ahead of me in line if they only have a few items or are obviously in a rush.
do those count?
Comments
absolutely!! people like you make the world a happier place. +5
Report
by ICU says April is Autism Awareness Mo. on January 20th, 2009
thank you. although i realize that mentioning it here kinda made it bragging, but it wasn't meant like that. i wish more people would consider doing these small acts more often. what goes around, comes around.
Report
by Leeses Pieces is COATed in chocolate on January 20th, 2009
yes it does. I didnt mean for the question to sound like I was bragging. I hope no one took it like that :) I just like to hear when good things happen to people. Once this man lost his wallet and was tearing his car apart with a panicked look on his face. I asked what was wrong and he told me. I said I hope you find it, lunch is on me. He was shocked. LOL.... he didnt want me to pay for it. But in the end he was grateful.

by ICU says April is Autism Awareness Mo. on January 20th, 2009
oh it didn't sound that way, i just thought that my answer did. i love hearing about these kinds of acts too. i don't think about it, so i have probably done it a lot, but it surprises me when i hear about other people doing because it IS so rare.
